events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred last night on Main Street, resulting in visible damage to the front bumper and hood of the vehicle.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the details of the collision and the nature of the damages described by the claimant.
An agent was assigned to this claim to handle communications and coordinate further assessments related to the reported car accident.
The customer received an official acknowledgment of their claim submission with confirmation that the process has begun.
The agent requested the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates to proceed with the investigation.
The claimant submitted the requested police report along with detailed images of the damaged vehicle and an official repair quote.
The investigation team began reviewing all submitted documentation and contacted witnesses to verify the circumstances of the collision.
The investigation concluded confirming the insured party was not at fault and damage claims were validated with sufficient evidence.
A settlement offer was proposed based on repair costs and policy terms. The customer was notified of the compensation amount and terms.
The customer responded positively to the prompt settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the handling of their claim.
Following customer approval, the claim was officially approved for payment according to the agreed upon settlement offer.
The payment for the vehicle repairs was issued to the customer’s bank account as per the approved settlement details.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that payment was received and repairs began on the insured vehicle.
All claim records and documentation were archived in the company’s system for future reference and compliance requirements.
